MdkM18T8OS7bpjXzqRGs5g.text: An excellent addition to the constantly expanding gourmet burger scene in Edinburgh. The difference between BRGR and some of the other places- the prices here are amazing! From Monday-Friday, all burgers are 4, rising to a still amazing 5 at the weekend. On top of this, there are beer bottles for 2 and great price milkshakes too. Oh, but what about the quality, I hear you say. You get what you pay for, right?  Wrong, the burgers here are really good quality- the ingredients all taste good, portion sizes are great, and the variety on offer on the menu is impressive. I had a delicious burger involving haggis, whilst Mary had a vegetarian burger made of halloumi. Both went down very well, as did the delicious fries we shared.  Really impressed by BRGR. Will definitely be back!

Pneha_7XNRP0eZCd7ui3-Q.text: I ordered a moo-less vegan burger with vegan mince and salad, vegan chicken nuggets with fries, and a diet irn bru through Just Eat. I received the vegan burger, but it was missing the vegan mince and extra salad, and I received the vegan nuggets but was missing the fries. Other than these mishaps, the food, as always, was excellent and I will order again in future.

photos.caption: Photo of BRGR - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Screenshot of my Just Eat order

tkjncwnLlQ_DtLmRM_e3Lg.text: We were waiting forever to get our food served and the food delivery guys were waiting even longer ... However, the burger was actually quite good.

8p3jBCfs4opaAe9rP7oWQg.text: Expected a great burger......instead got a tasteless wee thing that didn't even resemble anything I've ever had!! Paid too much asxwell

Nku_elMkUnlm4vTmOaUZiQ.text: The food here is pretty good considering it's relatively low price point compared to surrounding burger restaurants but be wary that even though it's advertised as "4 Burgers", you are likely to spend more than that after including chips and a drink with your meal. The problem comes in the form of spotty service from the staff. Most members of the staff are really kind and helpful, providing top notch service, however just like the saying goes, bad apples truly ruin the bunch. On our last visit, our server Ana seemed like she had no care in the world for any of her customers, acting in a very rude manner for the entirety of the dining experience. Most of the time she just flat out ignored us leaving us sitting around wondering when we would be helped.  TL;DR If you're willing to overlook the relatively spotty service that seriously needs to be addressed by management in the form of proper hiring and training practices, the food here is quite tasty!

9d1lAmGh_Z8Xj4BlSdc2FQ.text: It was good, but not great. As far as cheap reliable eats are concerned, this is it. How do you mess up a hamburger.. I would later find an answer to that in London, but I wont go into that here. This Burger is solid. No frills on this Hamburg, just meat and cheese and maybe a sauce or two. Would visit again.

Cn_NgQELqPUXsCgN9W9Upw.text: Quick dinnertime snack with some tired, hungry friends. Burgers only 4 on weekdays! Shakes are good, too: I had the Ferrero. Friendly crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of BRGR - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

KML8RbPOLbmbVOBJ8MXooA.text: Good price for a quick dinner and for students. Yummy milkshakes but lacking good veggie options!

54gW99JuPQJn5Z3yNh1h9Q.text: Arrived today and ordered the Oreo milkshake, the Parmesan fries, and the blue cheese and bacon burger. Everything was delicious and signage has been corrected. Would eat here again and shall recommend to all my friends. Thank you for great service!

photos.caption: Photo of BRGR - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Y10_y1Q7XR7ann-cx6dgOA.text: Food's fine for the price. Had a veggie burger and halloumi salad. Salad was as advertised, burger was alright but served with a strangely too-sweet bun and chili sauce.   Staff was friendly and quick, even when busy.   However, I will never again endorse the business model of serving everything on disposable kitchenware while in a sit-down, table service restaurant - burgers wrapped in aluminum foil, tap water in plastic cups, salads served on paper bowls with one-use forks, fries in paper bags. It's tacky, unnecessary, and absolutely awful for the environment.

Ye8fLIZerTjPMT5T-NV5yw.text: Hands down one of the best burger places in Edinburgh. I normally get a chicken burger but I've tried the beef ones and they're all good. The flavors are perfect, and I love the fries. The milkshakes are also top quality. Even better, it's soooo cheap. I can't believe how good it is for the price and keep waiting for them to realize this and raise their prices. (Please don't though.) Definitely a fan.

k8-UtLY92KP8ZcntSfjGGw.text: Got the fried chicken burger, chips with rosemary Parmesan salt, and vanilla milkshake. The milkshake was delicious, and perfect for a sunny day. The chips were pretty good, although I couldn't taste any rosemary and they could've been saltier. The burger was nice, if a bit dry. Nice juicy piece of chicken though.   Overall, a cool, relatively cheap place to go, but I've had better burgers.

7-Le4x6zmLHbP1K6bAXWcA.text: Really buzzy joint serving bargain burgers. Juicy burgers and crispy chips served by friendly and enthusiastic staff. Lively decor with a prominence of red. Does well what many places are doing for twice the price. Good music too.

xgkBGNPmARbto7bM301RQQ.text: 5 for a burger! Absolute steal except that the burgers themselves are very dry and substandard. With so many burger places opened up in the last few months, this place will need to up its game.

us8p-zuzVyy9akq7f7sJAQ.text: Went here today for the first time. Really good burger and CHEAP compared to any other burger in town (4 on weekdays). I got the bleu cheese with bacon burger, and the meat was clearly hand-made, not from a frozen patty. Nice size, large, tasty. I don't know how they can do these prices, but I will keep coming as long as it stays that way.  The place plays recent pop/rock music, and the service is friendly. They even have kids menus. If you're from the States, it has a Five Guys feel. The colors are the same, and the fries even come out in a white paper cup.

x9PUNbX0R_gMV5Xu7ziv2Q.text: We were in Edinburgh for four days and all the time We went around, but last day We tried and it was good choice. I had cheese and bacon burger with chilli cheese fries and the burger was just right as it should be. Meat is fresh, juicy and really good. Fries are from real potatoes. Chilli cheese fried are good, but not good match with burger, next time I will try regular. And the prices are super cheap for Edinburgh restaurant. Many students and local are visiting the place, you can not miss it!
